TopicTitle: How can I dock parts of a base on the ground?

Articles.Content:
Lately I've been trying to build a surface base design I can use for the Mun and other places. I've decided to send it up in several pieces and then put it together on site. But when I tried to make a prototype at KSC, the docking ports won't connect.

http://imgur.com/PjahDzg (link because I don't have the priviledge to post pictures yet).

It looks like they're connected in this picture, but they aren't. They get magnetic attraction but they don't merge into one ship. I also tried to park two of the habitation module together (the one with wheels on the left) but they still won't merge even though with the same design I know the ports are at the same height.

Since this has already been suggested, yes I've tried extending and retracting the landing gear. Again, I get the magnetic attraction but no connection.

Edited May 11, 2014 by Blind Dead McJones

[]

Edited August 2, 2019 by CvVtjRtb

Try using capsule torque to wiggle one of them around until they dock.

Also, make sure SAS is turned off.

Wiggling it around didn't seem to work, but I might have forgot about SAS. I'll go try that.

Edit: Got it to work this time. Thanks, everybody! So, uh, how do I mark this as answered?

Edited May 11, 2014 by Blind Dead McJones
Retract the gear on the wheeled module. Counterintuitively, this often works for me. If that doesn't work, back up, try again, rinse and repeat.

Wiggling it around didn't seem to work, but I might have forgot about SAS. I'll go try that.

Edit: Got it to work this time. Thanks, everybody! So, uh, how do I mark this as answered?

Glad you got it fixed.

You can edit the first post, then click "Go Advanced." There is a dropdown where you can mark it as answered, then save.
